content.description:
This short Vedauwoo type crack is 15 feet east of

The Nipple

.  Start under the small overhang and pull/jam up the crack.
content.protection: Top rope with slings and gear.

content.description:
15 feet right of

Chance

a right running roof develops near the ground.  Start at the left end of the roof and pull over it.  Follow easy rock up to a line of 3 bolts, crux at each bolt.  Exit left near the top to the anchor.
content.protection: 3 bolts to a two bolt anchor with hooks.

content.description: At the top of the slab, just up from the rap anchors is an obvious overhanging rock that looks like a nipple.  A bolt is in the center of the nipple proper.  Slab up slotting a small cam, undercling and mantle over the top of the nipple.  Easy move tops out the climb.  Walk of the back.

Use the same start the same as for

Stumpy

at the left end of the right running roof.  Traverse 15 feet right and go up at the first bolt.  Follow easy ground to a right-slanting crack.  Clip the next bolt and crimp and slab this one 5.11 move.  Easy slab up and left to the anchors.
content.protection: Two bolts and a 1 1/2 to 2 inch cam. End at the two bolt anchors with hooks.

content.description: On the far right of Nancy's Rock slab a shallow crack runs up.  It is run out on top, easy to anchors.
content.protection: Small to medium gear for a sometimes flaring crack.  Two bolt anchor with hooks.

content.description: The route begins on the far left side of the slab in an often boggy area.  Beware of poison ivy.  Start up the steep, edgy face (5.9) past bolts and supplemented cams to a small protrusion or roof. Climb over the roof, (5.6).  Go up to a top out and step across and right to the base of the finishing slab.  Edge past one bolt (5.8) and finish with runout 5.4 to the anchors.
content.protection: 4 bolts and 1/2 to 2 inch cams in three places supplement the route.  The R rating is for the runout past the last bolt.  The runout is only 5.4, and the crux is well protected.

content.description:
Drive 5.5 miles west of the Beige Siphon Tube to a paved pullout on the north side of the road. Hike 30 yards uphill to the slab.

This is De Gueo, 5.10-. Cling, edge, and smear up the left blunt arete to the upper face. Edge past two nickle thick smears, and reach long for the good hold.
content.protection: 4 bolts to a two bolt anchor with a link and a biner-like snaplink.

content.description: In the center of the face, a crack develops 20 feet up.  Climb to the crack and up till it runs out.  Smear past one bolt to the anchors.
content.protection: Small nuts and cams with one bolt.  Two bolt anchor with hooks.

content.description: 5.5 miles west of the Beige Siphon Tube is a paved pullout on the north side of the road. Hike 30 yards up hill to the rock (Nancy's Rock). Start at the bottom of a large black section of rock, and climb up easy rock to the bulge and first bolt. Go up and left is 5.9, up and right is 5.6. Smear past two more bolts to the top.
content.protection: 3 bolts to a two bolt anchor with Mussy hooks.
